```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
```

```{r setup}
library(details)
```

You can wrap print methods of R objects in a `details` environment.

  1. [data.frame](#data.frame)
  1. [tibble](#tibble)
  1. [list](#list)
  1. [plots](#plots)
  
### data.frame

```{r}
 iris%>%
  details::details(summary = 'data.frame')
```

### tibble

```{r}
 iris%>%
  tibble::as_tibble()%>%
  details::details(summary = 'tibble')
```

## list

```{r}
 list(a = 1,b = head(iris))%>%
  details::details(summary = 'list')
```

## plots

```{r,eval = httr::status_code(httr::HEAD('imgur.com',httr::timeout(1)))==200L}

details(
  plot(x=mtcars$mpg,y=mtcars$wt),
  summary = 'plots')

```
